dataset.title: GIS50 Coverages Defining the Konza Producer Data Sample Locations

address.deliveryPoint: 116 Ackert Hall, Division of Biology, Kansas State University

para.literalLayout:
These data show the sample locations for datasets pertaining to primary production at Konza Prairie. These data reference various treatments across Konza including varying burn frequencies, belowground plots, patch burn, exclosures, etc. Record type one (GIS500) contains sample locations for estimated standing crop biomass in various burning-grazing treatments (PABXX).
Record type six (GIS505) contains sample locations for peak foliage biomass, and belowground species composition measured at the belowground plot experiments (PBB0X and BGPVC respectively).
Record type 11 and 12 contain the transect (GIS510) and plot (GIS511) locations for plots in the patch-burn experiments (PBGXX).
Record type 16 (GIS515) contains the locations of exclosures used to sample primary productivity in bison grazed watersheds (PEB01).
Record type 21 (GIS520) contains the locations of exclosures used to sample primary productivity in cattle grazed watersheds (PEB01_X).
Record type 26 (GIS525) contains the locations of sample sites for litterfall (PGLXX) collectors in the gallery forest.
Record type 31 (GIS530) contains species composition transects for Konza Prairie. These data may be used in conjunction species composition (PVC01 and PVC02), primary production in grazing exclosures (PEB01, PEB01_X), soil chemistry and bulk density (NSC01) and primary production (PAB01).

We ask all publications, reports and proposals who use any data from KNZ acknowledge cite the KNZ program using the following statement: "Data for XXX was supported by the NSF Long Term Ecological Research Program at Konza Prairie Research Natural Area"; where XXX is the list of data sets used in the publications, reports or proposals.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Riley CountyGeary countyKansasKonza Prairie Biological StationKNZLTER

contact.organizationName: Konza Prairie Biological Station, Div. of Biology, Kansas State University

spatialVector.entityName: GIS500 Aboveground primary production on fire frequency treatments
spatialVector.entityDescription: Estimates of standing crop biomass (grams per square meter) of live graminoids, forbs, woody plants, and previous year's dead vegetation for 2 soil types (shallow and deep) and various burning-grazing treatments are made at the coordinates contained in this dataset. This data may be used in conjunction with the Aboveground primary production on fire frequency treatments (PABXX) datasets for spatially explicit analyses of these data.

externallyDefinedFormat.formatName: zip file with ARC/INFO shape file

parameter.name: Scale factor at central meridian
parameter.description: a multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the central meridian.

parameter.description: The line of logitude at the center of the map projection

parameter.description: The latitude chosen as center of the projection

parameter.name: False Easting
parameter.description: A value added in a rectangular coordinate system, usually used to avoid negative values

spatialVector.entityName: GIS505 Aboveground biomass on belowground plots
spatialVector.entityDescription: Peak foliage biomass is measured annually in late summer on the 64 belowground plots which are represented here. This data may be used in conjunction with Aboveground biomass on belowground plots (PBBXX) datasets for spatially explicit analyses of these data.

spatialVector.entityName: GIS510 Vegetation changes from patch burning grazed pastures
spatialVector.entityDescription: Canopy cover was recorded in 20 circular 10 m2 plots in pastures seasonally grazed by cattle. Each unit consisted of three pastures, one which was burned and two that were not burned. The burn was rotated so that each pasture was burned every third year. The three pasture unit was stocked with cow/calf pairs from approximately 1 May until 1 Oct at a stocking density equal to 3.2 ha per cow/calf. This dataset contains the transects which intersect the 10 m2 plots. This data may be used in conjunction with the Vegetation changes from patch burning grazed pastures (PBGXX) datasets for spatially explicit analyses of these data.

spatialVector.entityName: GIS511 Vegetation changes from patch burning grazed pastures
spatialVector.entityDescription: Canopy cover was recorded in 20 circular 10 m2 plots in pastures seasonally grazed by cattle. Each unit consisted of three pastures, one which was burned and two that were not burned. The burn was rotated so that each pasture was burned every third year. The three pasture unit was stocked with cow/calf pairs from approximately 1 May until 1 Oct at a stocking density equal to 3.2 ha per cow/calf. This dataset represents the plots. This data may be used in conjunction with the Vegetation changes from patch burning grazed pastures (PBGXX) datasets for spatially explicit analyses of these data.

spatialVector.entityName: GIS515 Primary production in grazing exclosures
spatialVector.entityDescription: To determine long term effects of bison grazing on aboveground primary production. This dataset represents the exclosures in which the data is collected.

spatialVector.entityName: GIS520 Primary production in cattle grazing exclosures
spatialVector.entityDescription: To determine long term effects of cattle grazing on aboveground primary production. This dataset represents the exclosures in which the data is collected. This data may be used in conjunction with the ***Primary Production in Cattle Grazing Exclosures (PEB_X)**** datasets for spatially explicit analyses of these data.

spatialVector.entityDescription: Litterfall of a Kansas gallery forest is measured with 60, deep-dish litterfall collecters. This data set contains the locations of the collectors. This data may be used in conjunction with the Gallery forest litterfall (PGLXX) datasets for spatially explicit analyses of these data.

spatialVector.entityDescription: Contains species composition transects for Konza Prairie Biological Station. Locations of permenant line transects were recorded using GPS and converted to an Arc/Info coverage. Transects are attributed with watershed and transect ID information. This cover may be used in conjunction with KPBS species composition (PVC01 and PVC02), Primary production in grazing exclosures (PEB01, PEB01_X), Soil chemistry and bulk density (NSC01) and primary production (PAB01) datasets for spatially explicit analyses of these data

horizontalAccuracy.accuracyReport: Collected with Trimble Pathfinder Pro GPS unit with real time differential correction. This unit is capable of submeter accuracy in this mode.
